page.title: 17TRANSPORT/ROADS NASH AREA
page.content: The only major road is the B4033, this links Winslow to the south and Stony Stratford to the north. The surface is tarmac, width 6m. Five tarmac minor roads turn off the B4033, northwards at a 90 bend, is Nash High Street, 5m wide, through village; Thornborough Road, 4.5m wide running west and Whaddon Road running east form a cross road system to the north of Nash. At Beachampton, Watery Lane, 3m wide, the B4033 to the east feeds some very old houses; the surface to the ford being tarmac and from the ford waterbound stones to its termination at Grove Farm. At the north end of Beachampton a road 5m wide runs west to Thornton. Traffic consists of local cars and tractors with a light flow passing through.Public transport is almost non-existant .
